title: Paan Singh Tomar:Paan Singh Tomar, A 7-time National Steeplechase Champion Who Became A Dacoit And Was Killed In An Encounter
text:
Paan Singh Tomar's biopic hit the big screens in 2012 and just like the story, the life of this athlete took a turn for the worst in real life.

Born into a Rajput family in the village of Bhidosa, Tomar joined the Army and soon impressed one and all with his fast running speeds. It is said that he was given punishment once by a superior officer to run laps and other officers saw him and were impressed. He was put on the sportsman's diet and his training exempted him from other duties. Because he was a sportsman, he was not allowed to fight in the 1962, 1965 or 1971 wars while in service. Tomar's sports career ended in 1972 and his Army stint was over in 1977.

Shutterstock

He was the national champion in steeplechase on 7 occasions. He also represented India in the 1958 Asian Games.

After leaving the service he returned to his village. Due to a land dispute with his nephews, things got out of control quickly and it resulted in him taking a life. He had to become a dacoit as tensions rose. The killing of his elder brother resulted in severe backlash from his side as well and pretty soon the police came to take him in or down if necessary.

Tomar's standoff came to an end when he was shot dead in an encounter against a task force. A sports career that had enthralled many at national level ended in tragedy. A promising life ending in the worst possible way.

Circumstances made him take this path, while it does not justify what he did, it is sad that there was no help to begin with. The man had represented India and also served his nation. Tomar belongs in that list of athletes who were hung out to dry. In his case, he ended up taking a bullet.
